Idiom (Yoruba): Ẹ̀dá kì í mọ ibi tí a ti ń gbé e ní sánra
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: People rarely know the true source of their own prosperity
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: One does not often realize what makes them successful
Usage Contexts: Proverbial speech, wisdom, reflection, life advice
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Yoruba traditional belief in destiny and ancestral blessings
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): ɛ̀.dá kì í mɔ̀ ì.bì tí à tí ń ɡbé ɛ ní sã́.rà
First Example Sentence: Ẹ̀dá kì í mọ ibi tí a ti ń gbé e ní sánra; ó fi ẹnu rí ẹyẹ, ó mọ òrùlé.
Second Example Sentence: Bí a ṣe ń rí ire, ká rántí pé ẹ̀dá kì í mọ ibi tí a ti ń gbé e ní sánra.
Third Example Sentence: Ọkùnrin náà ń jẹun l'ọ̀pọ̀, ṣùgbọ́n kì í mọ ibi tí a ti ń gbé e ní sánra.

Idiom (Yoruba): Ẹyẹ lẹ́yẹ ń gbé, bí a bá fi ọwọ́ pa a, ẹ̀sẹ̀ là fi ń tọ́ ọ
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: If you mistreat someone trusting you, they may retaliate
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Folklore metaphor from hunting and animals
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): ɛ.jɛ̀ lɛ́.jɛ̀ ń ɡbé, bí a bá fì ɔ́.wɔ́ pà a, ɛ̀.ʃɛ̀ là fì ń tɔ́ ɔ
First Example Sentence: Ẹyẹ lẹ́yẹ ń gbé, ṣùgbọ́n bí a bá fi ọwọ́ pa a, ẹ̀sẹ̀ là fi ń tọ́ ọ.
Second Example Sentence: Ọrẹ rẹ kì í dá lójú mọ́; ẹyẹ lẹ́yẹ ń gbé...
Third Example Sentence: Rántí pé ẹyẹ lẹ́yẹ ń gbé, kí o má ṣe fi ọwọ́ pa a.

Idiom (Yoruba): A kì í kọ́ ọmọ lẹ́hìn ogún kó mọ ìrìn àjò
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Experience is the best teacher, not inheritance
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: One learns life through experience, not wealth
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Traditional Yoruba values on learning through journey
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): à kì í kɔ́ ɔ́.mɔ̀ lɛ́.hĩ̀ ɔ.ɡṹ kó mɔ̀ ì.rĩ̀ à.d͡ʒɔ
First Example Sentence: A kì í kọ́ ọmọ lẹ́hìn ogún kó mọ ìrìn àjò; ayé kì í ṣe pípa.
Second Example Sentence: Láìrìn àjò, a kì í mọ bí ayé ṣe rí – a kì í kọ́ ọmọ lẹ́hìn ogún.
Third Example Sentence: Ọmọ ọlọ́rọ̀ náà ṣì jẹ́ òmùgọ̀; a kì í kọ́ ọmọ lẹ́hìn ogún kó mọ ìrìn àjò.

Idiom (Yoruba): Ọgbọ́n ẹni kì í tán ní kẹ́tẹ́kẹ́tẹ́
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: No matter how clever one is, they still have flaws or limits
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Draws from traditional Yoruba tales about donkeys
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): ɔ.ɡbɔ́ŋ ɛ́.nĩ̀ kì í tã́ ní kɛ́.tɛ́.kɛ́.tɛ́
First Example Sentence: Ọgbọ́n ẹni kì í tán ní kẹ́tẹ́kẹ́tẹ́; gbogbo wa ní àìlera.
Second Example Sentence: Kí olóye máa mọ̀ pé ọgbọ́n ẹni kì í tán ní kẹ́tẹ́kẹ́tẹ́.
Third Example Sentence: Àgbàlagbà náà rò pé ó mọ ohun gbogbo, ṣùgbọ́n ọgbọ́n ẹni kì í tán ní kẹ́tẹ́kẹ́tẹ́.

Idiom (Yoruba): Ojú lásán kì í jẹ́ kí ẹyẹ fò
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Looking alone doesn’t achieve anything; effort is needed
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Wishing without effort brings no result
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common teaching metaphor in Yoruba culture
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): ɔ.d͡ʒú là.sã̀ kì í d͡ʒɛ́ kî ɛ.jɛ̀ fò
First Example Sentence: Ojú lásán kì í jẹ́ kí ẹyẹ fò; ṣe iṣẹ́ rẹ!
Second Example Sentence: Oúnjẹ ò ní wá sílẹ̀ fún ẹni tí kò ṣiṣẹ́ – ojú lásán kì í jẹ́ kí ẹyẹ fò.
Third Example Sentence: Bó ṣe ń wo iṣẹ́ àwọn mìíràn, ojú lásán kì í jẹ́ kí ẹyẹ fò.

Idiom (Yoruba): Ẹnu kì í sọnù ká má mọ ibi tí a ti ń lọ
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: One who speaks up won’t lose direction
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): ɛ̀.nú kì í sɔ̀.nù ká má mɔ̀ ì.bì tí a tí ń lɔ́
First Example Sentence: Ẹnu kì í sọnù ká má mọ ibi tí a ti ń lọ, béèrè!
Second Example Sentence: Ọmọ náà ní ìbànújẹ, mo sọ fún un pé ẹnu kì í sọnù.
Third Example Sentence: Ẹ̀gbẹ́ wa yá ká sọ pé ẹnu kì í sọnù ká má mọ ibi tí a ti ń lọ.

Idiom (Yoruba): Kò mọ ọn ní ìyá, ó pe e ní bàbá
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Speaking confidently on what one doesn’t understand
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common social jab in Yoruba banter
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): kɔ̀ mɔ̀ ɔ̃̀ ní ì.já, ó pɛ́ ɛ ní bà.bá
First Example Sentence: Kò mọ ọn ní ìyá, ó pe e ní bàbá – ẹ jẹ́ ká kó òye.
Second Example Sentence: Ọkùnrin náà kọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ náà dáadáa, kò mọ ọn ní ìyá, ó pe e ní bàbá.
Third Example Sentence: Ṣé ò rí i pé kò mọ ọn ní ìyá, ó pe e ní bàbá?

Idiom (Yoruba): Bí a bá fi ojú sọ ọ, kì í ṣe pé a fẹ́ kó kú
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Criticism doesn’t mean hatred; it can be out of love
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Saying hard truths doesn’t mean animosity
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): bí a bá fì ɔ.d͡ʒú sɔ̀ ɔ, kì í ʃɛ́ pé à fɛ́ kó kú
First Example Sentence: Bí a bá fi ojú sọ ọ, kì í ṣe pé a fẹ́ kó kú; ìfẹ́ ni.
Second Example Sentence: Ẹ̀gbọ́n mi, gbọ́ mi dáadáa – bí a bá fi ojú sọ ọ, kì í ṣe pé a fẹ́ kó kú.
Third Example Sentence: Ọmọ náà bínú, ṣùgbọ́n bí a bá fi ojú sọ ọ, kì í ṣe pé a fẹ́ kó kú.

Idiom (Yoruba): Ajá tó bá máa ṣọ́ ọ́lé kì í bọ láti ọjọ́ kẹta
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: People often show their true intentions early on
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Dog as metaphor in Yoruba sayings
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): à.d͡ʒá tó bá má ʃɔ́ ɔ́.lɛ̀ kì í bɔ̀ lá.tí ɔ.ʤɔ́ kɛ́.tà
First Example Sentence: Ajá tó bá máa ṣọ́ ọ́lé kì í bọ láti ọjọ́ kẹta – ẹ fura!
Second Example Sentence: Bí ọmọ náà ṣe ń hù, ó dàbí ajá tó máa ṣọ́ ọ́lé.
Third Example Sentence: Ọjọ́ kẹta ni wọ́n kọ́ wa pé ajá tó bá máa ṣọ́ ọ́lé kì í bọ.

Idiom (Yoruba): Agbára òrò l’ó ju agbára ọwọ́ lọ
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Words can be more powerful than physical force
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Speech can achieve more than violence
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Emphasizes traditional Yoruba value of oratory
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Yoruba): à.ɡbá.rà ɔ.rɔ̀ ló d͡ʒù à.ɡbá.rà ɔ́.wɔ́ lɔ
First Example Sentence: Agbára òrò l’ó ju agbára ọwọ́ lọ – ẹ̀rọ lágba.
Second Example Sentence: Kí wọ́n má ṣe fọ́, agbára òrò ju ti ọwọ́ lọ.
Third Example Sentence: Láti bọ ninu ìṣòro, agbára òrò ju agbára ọwọ́ lọ.
